summary: "Presumed Innocent" is a 1990 thriller movie about a prosecutor, Rusty Sabich (played by Harrison Ford), falsely accused of murdering his colleague and lover. Based on Scott Turow's novel, the film was directed by Alan J. Pakula. It was well-received by critics and made a lot of money. The story follows Rusty's struggle to prove his innocence, with filming taking place in several locations. The movie led to a TV miniseries and a sequel.
title: Presumed Innocent (film)
